title: Is it just me or is LoL the most toxic game ever?
body: I swear every game there is that 1 salty kid or that 1 'Diamond' smurf who's playing in a lower elo and expects us to be good. I think Riot needs to do something about this. Is league the most toxic game ever?

It is riots fault. only you take the wrong end of it. it is not the reporting system that needs improvement. Also not the tribunal. i wont change peoples behavior as there are always new players coming in that have yet to come in contact with that system. the problem and thats is the reason why this game enables toxicity lies within the game itself. First of all this is a game that is displayed as a multiplayer game. however if you loose a teamfight and you try to help your teammates you get nothing out of sacrificing yourself. Also you see how the game focuses on kills by last hits and not by kill participation. This shows that even though its a 5v5 game it really focuses on the individual playtsyle and less on the teamwork. So first of all it is a game that provides players with a high source of egoism potential.

Secondly this game enables toxicity by being so transparent on peoples mistakes and also their success, which is all determined individually as opposed to a teamwork game. 

I give you an example. A person that has a hard match up has like 150 cs after 25 mins in top. The team starts loosing. Bot supp presses tab because he thinks he didnt make a mistake based on his kda and his warding. he sees top farm and starts flaming him. Now yeah its still the people that are toxic, but the game provides them with the necessities to do so and basically puts it over their hear if you understand what i mean. And this is only one example. i didnt go over dmg dealt to champions that can be overlooked by all of the 2 team on each other. i didnt go over kills which basically only means last hit. i did not go over assists(which usually arent mentioned in these kind of debates and the supp is usually blamed since has no kills just assists but ok). And there is much more such as match history and other things. So when i am saying riot does nothing against toxicity i dont mean nothing against the behavior of the people but nothing to prevent this behavior in the first place by not providing a source and a game that drives on these kind of emotions.

Since LoL became more and more known as the "toxic game with all the trolls" it has created a kind of paradox in itself. 

Everyone thinks everyone else is a troll. which gives them a negative view of everyone else before a game has started, which can cause them to take a lot of things personally as a result.

Plus there is the competitiveness of the game, which brings out people's desire to win and be the best and that desire to win usually comes out as aggression.

Rather than focusing on what they do we need to look at why they do it, and I believe it comes from the identity we have given ourselves.

Ah yes the good old self fulfilling prophecy. Funny things that once immersed in are very hard to break. And of course, Riot has very little control over the direction the community takes with their behaviour, just as they do not choose the meta.

I'm all for people wanting Riot to do better where they can, because that kind of push means better services and systems for us, but ultimately as far as I'm concerned the blame for bad behaviour lies with the players. We don't blame the police for the asshole that decided to set a building on fire that one time now do we? Sure after a point it's negligence on the Police's part but there's only so much they can do as far as preventative measures, and I think the new honour will be a very good one.

Exactly. Since the general LoL community became known as a toxic place, the players started to unconsciously see more things as being negative/toxic which some people reacted negatively at.

Or in other words, people started to view more and more things as being "negative/toxic/trolling" which causes people to react in a generally negative way, which created a negative spiral, which has ultimately lead to the issue we have today. people viewing everything not positive as bad and the desire for both the players and Riot to remove all the bad. Cept Riot as better understanding as a whole on what an impossible task that is.
Yeah there's no quicker way to understand just how difficult a seemingly simple job is than trying it.
